error.signature: WARNING: Retrying (Retry(total=0)) after connection broken by 'ProxyError': Cannot connect to proxy

verdict.summary: Pip cannot connect through the configured HTTP/HTTPS proxy. Common in corporate environments where proxy settings are misconfigured, proxy requires authentication, or the proxy server is down.

dead_ends.why_fails: trusted-host only skips certificate verification for the index; it does not fix proxy connectivity issues
In corporate networks, removing proxy settings means no internet access at all

workarounds.action: Set correct proxy with authentication: pip install --proxy http://user:pass@proxy:port <package>
Configure pip.conf with proxy settings permanently
Use no_proxy to bypass proxy for internal PyPI mirrors

leads_to.condition: when proxy intercepts SSL with its own certificate

preceded_by.condition: when initial timeout leads to proxy error on retry

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Proxy errors are about connection to the proxy itself; SSL errors are about certificate validation which can happen through or without a proxy
